DELETE /accounts/{account_id}/pcaps/owne.description: Deletes buckets added to the packet captures API.

204.description: Delete buckets for full packet captures response

default.description: Delete buckets for full packet captures response failure

DELETE /accounts/{account_id}/pcaps/owne.summary: Delete buckets for full packet captures

GET /accounts/{account_id}/pcaps.description: Lists all packet capture requests for an account.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

count.description: Total number of results for the requested service

page.description: Current page within paginated list of results

per_page.description: Number of results per page of results

total_count.description: Total results available without any search parameters

filter_v1.description: The packet capture filter. When this field is empty, all packets are captured.

destination_address.description: The destination IP address of the packet.

destination_port.description: The destination port of the packet.

protocol.description: The protocol number of the packet.

source_address.description: The source IP address of the packet.

source_port.description: The source port of the packet.

id.description: The ID for the packet capture.

status.description: The status of the packet capture request.

submitted.description: The RFC 3339 timestamp when the packet capture was created.

system.description: The system used to collect packet captures.

time_limit.description: The packet capture duration in seconds.

type.description: The type of packet capture. `Simple` captures sampled packets, and `full` captures entire payloads and non-sampled packets.

byte_limit.description: The maximum number of bytes to capture. This field only applies to `full` packet captures.

colo_name.description: The name of the data center used for the packet capture. This can be a specific colo (ord02) or a multi-colo name (ORD). This field only applies to `full` packet captures.

destination_conf.description: The full URI for the bucket. This field only applies to `full` packet captures.

error_message.description: An error message that describes why the packet capture failed. This field only applies to `full` packet captures.
error_message.example: No packets matched the filter in the time limit given. Please modify the filter or try again.
